availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James H. Edelen (Lebanon, Marion County, Kentucky, merchant and druggist)

body.p: Lebanon, Marion County, Kentucky, merchant and druggist. Kentucky native. Son of Leonard Edelen and Susan Edelen. Married to Mary Lewis Edelen in Mercer County on January 23, 1855. Father of Sallie Edelen, Thomas S. Edelen. Merchant in Marion County in 1860. Employed Frank M. Coward in Marion County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, County, City/District, p. X

Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, X County Marriages, Film #000191862.
Find A Grave, "J. H. Edelen (August 15, 1833-September 13, 1902)," Memorial #112259404, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/112259404 (accessed February 5, 2019).
